Sorry Mr Goodwin, but I've installed Python 2.2 (C:/Python22) and Cantera 1=
.4 (unzip =3D> C:/cantera-1.4  and C:/.../.../cantera-1.4) and when I run f=
lame.py, it did not work. There is probably a basically problem with enviro=
nment variable setting. Could you help please ?
Thank you.
Mathiew


---------- Initial Header -----------

From      : David Goodwin <dgoodwin@...>
To          : cantera@yahoogroups.com
Cc          :=20
Date      : Mon, 5 May 2003 07:33:33 -0700
Subject : [cantera] flames

Mathiew,

You can do flame simulations under Windows - there is no need to switch =
=20
to linux, unless of course you want to for other reasons. Get the two =20
Windows .exe installer files from the sourceforge site (you can follow =20
the link from www.cantera.org), and get Python 2.2 from www.python.org =20
or blue.caltech.edu/cantera_dist,  Install them all, then open the =20
folder of Python examples in the Cantera folder on your desktop, and =20
run 'flame1.py' or 'flame2.py.'  If you like, edit one of these to set =20
your own flame parameters.

Dave G.
